answerText: Nernst equation[10] The Nernst equation is used to calculate the reduction potential of one of these components of a redox reaction. These mathematical constructs show either the oxidation or a reduction of a single species, and are then added together to give the overall "full" reaction.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | 8 | 14 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The Goldman-Hodgkins-Katz equation generalizes this equation by considering a semipermeable membrane with multiple ions flitting across it. For 10 points each: [10] Name this equation developed by a German chemist, which gives the reduction potential of a cell from the concentrations of the reductant and oxidant.
